Description: Lower body and conical foot sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style, possibly patterned, pottery chalice; glaze fired red-brown; white slip; interior glazed with trace of reserved dot in centre of bowl; exterior: bowl reserved, foot; inscription on reserved underside.
Curator's comments: The number 764 is written in pencil on the underside of the foot. For parallels regarding squat patterned chalices, see Lemos no. 1062 from Kamiros.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1030) (phase 2)
